loans.use: To purchase cattle, expand existing businesses and repair a vehicle

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieta que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Mrs. Sarim H., 48, is a widow and has six children, three of whom are employed in different businesses, while another one is attending school. The remaining two are still too young to study. Mrs. Sarim H. and her children live in the Sya Village, Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer cultivating crops twice a year. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice; in the dry season, she grows vegetables. Currently, Mrs. Sarim H. is unable to plant rice, because she does not have enough cows to plow the rice field. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to be able to buy another cow for this purpose.  Previously, Mrs. Sarim H. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding, and she fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to plow a field

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokea S. is 37 years old and has been farming rice for about eighteen years. She is married to Mr. Sokun Shav, 39, and they live in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province. They have three children, all of whom are living in the family home and are in school. She can earn 8,000 Riel (US $2.00) per day.

To prepare for the coming season, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 Riel (US $50.00) to purchase fertilizer to use for the rice crop. Sokea hopes the loan will increase her income and help to pay her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 43 year old entrepreneur and mother of seven children, who are all going to school. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya and began her current business selling second-hand and new clothes in 1996. She specializes in women's clothing, like skirts and dresses, as well as bed sheets. She periodically travels to Kampala in Uganda, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years of experience, and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base.

With this loan of $600, Pamela plans to expand her business by buying stock of new clothes.

loans.use: To buy stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La señora Olivia es cliente antigua, trabaja con la  institución desde el año 2004. Tiene como actividad  principal la elaboración de helados, que vende en un puesto callejero. Vive en alquiler, se pudo ver que el microcrédito le sirvió mucho para el desarrollo de su negocio. La señora no tiene créditos con otras Instituciones financieras siendo cliente exclusiva de Emprender. El Crédito que se le otorga será destinado en esta ocasión para la compra de una moderna máquina para hacer helados. Tiene una hija estudiante universitaria que le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Olivia is an old client. She has been with our institution since 2004. Her main job is selling ice-cream out in the streets. She rents. All previous loans have helped her business in a big way. Señora Olivia doesn't have any other loans with other financial institutions since she has been an exclusive client of Emprender. With this loan, she's hoping on investing the money in an ice-cream maker. She has a daughter who's currently going to college and she helps her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ice-cream maker machine

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali is a carpenter. He has requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua to pay the school fees for his three children. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is a 30-year-old trader. She is married with three children. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Teshie in Accra for seven years. With income from her business, Patricia is supporting two of her kids in junior high school while the last-born is still breastfeeding.

Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business, especially in this crucial election period in Ghana. She has lots of marketing experience with a strong customer base as compared to her competitors and very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes from the importers to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids to complete school. She is a member of the group called Israel Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Edna Fabiola

texts.es:
La señora Edna Fabiola tiene ya mas de 2 años de aplicarse a  su negocio, tiene una pequeña farmacia y también vende artículos escolares.
Su mayor necesidad en este instante es tener más variedad de mercancía y desea vender otros tipos de artículos. La ubicación del local es muy buena, sólo está ese negocio a su alrededor; Por consiguiente tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Edna Fabiola has run her small business for 2 years; she runs a small pharmacy/drug store and also sells school supplies. Her biggest need currently is to offer a greater variety of merchandise and she would like to sell other types of products as well. The location of her business is very good; since there are few businesses around hers, she sees a lot of demand.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 51 years old. She is divorced and has three children. One is still in school while the rest have completed senior high school and have been working for a while. Gladys lives with her children in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra. She is a retailer of charcoal and fries yam and fish for her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Gladys obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal, yam, fish, and pepper to increase her stock and earn the proceeds she needs to get her own store.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal, etc

loans.name: Ana Gonzalez

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 38 años  está acompañada con el señor Julio Medina que trabaja como vendedor ambulante de mercerías en el centro de la ciudad. Tienen  tres hijos de los cuales todos son menores de edad y dependientes de ellos. Ella se dedica a la peluquería.

Ana  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de   diez años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Donde realizo algunas refacciones  para montar su peluquería.
 
Ana, con sus ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su compañero hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Ana, comenta que tiene bastante trabajo. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cosméticos y materiales de peluquería, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She is married to Julio Medina who works as a street vendor in the centre of the city. They have three children who are all minors and dependent on them. She is a hairstylist. Ana has been in this business for more than 10 years and her business is located in her home, which she made alterations to in order to open her salon. Thanks to the income from her business, Ana contributes to the household income and together with her partner pays for the household expenses. Ana says that she has plenty of work; because of this, she wants to buy more cosmetics and styling materials so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three boys and a girl. She says her daughter has completed junior high school and has yet to continue. One of her sons is in primary school while the other two, a set of twins, have yet to start school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a pastor of one of the local churches in their community.

Doris is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Doris is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.en:
The “Las Amistosas” (“Friendly Women”) Village Bank is made up of 10 members (two men and eight women) from the town of Urcos, about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cusco. The group is just beginning its first loan cycles. Most of the group members have taken out loans before from other financial institutions, but for four members, this will be their very first loan. 

The clients are involved in a variety of different businesses: baking and selling bread, selling prepared food (like empanadas and stuffed, fried potatoes), selling locally grown vegetables in the jungle city of Puerto M., selling chicken, cutting and selling eucalyptus trees, renting out retail space, selling grains and dried foods, selling yerba mate at a bus stop, raising livestock and driving a bus. 

The group’s president, Balvina F., is a member of the local bread sellers’ cooperative, in which there are 62 members, including herself. The cooperative gives internal loans to its members, so Balvina has experience in group loans even though this is her first loan from Asociacion Arariwa. When a member of her cooperative breaks the group’s internal regulations, they are punished by being barred from work for one month. “We’re worse than the law,” she chuckles. Balvina plans to bring this same disciplined approach to Las Amistosas. “We must pay on time, faithfully every month, and be punctual,” she says. “The more punctual we are, the better we work together. We must help one another out.” Balvina also has an innovative plan for the group. She sells bread in Urcos’ Plaza de Armas, and says that on weekends and holidays, there are often many visitors looking for a good meal but little in the way of supply. She has proposed to the group that they take turns selling meals like “cuy” (guinea pig) on the Plaza on these occasions in order to generate reserve savings for the group, in case someone falls ill or can’t make a payment for any reason. 

Balvina plans to use her loan to buy bread flour and animal feed for some cows she has on a small farm she owns. Other group members will use their loans to buy potatoes, rice and oil in bulk; to buy vegetables; to buy chickens; to buy eucalyptus trees; to buy a plot of land; to outfit a restaurant, and to buy animal feed. The “Las Amistosas” group has pledged to repay their Kiva loan on time and in full.

loans.use: Buy bread flour, animal feed, vegetables, oil and rice, chickens, a plot of land, eucalyptus trees and other uses.

loans.name: Saua

texts.en: Saua M., 25, is single with no children.  She has several years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has  previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Saua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as twisties, lollies, t-shirts, frozen goods, etc.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
S. Nguyễn Thị (546991302) is a 53 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living S. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3100000 VND a month.

In 1999, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. S. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. S. is now requesting a loan of 15000000 VND which she will use to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 50 years old, married with four children in school. She is the owner of London shoes retail shop dealing with second hand shoes and clothes. This shop is located on Kiddukanya Road in Kalisizo Town Council and has been running for 14 years so far.

She will use her loan to purchase more stock -- to buy different types of shoes and bring in more blouses and womens trousers. Hopefully, in the future, she wants to have a very big business dealing on both a retail and wholesale basis.

loans.use: To purchase more stock -- different types of shoes and more blouses and womens trousers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.fr: N. Gladys est née vers 1956 à Sazoué dans la Commune de Grand-Popo dans le Département du MONO au Sud du Bénin. Gladys est mariée à ASSIAME Florentin un fonctionnaire d’Etat actuellement à la retraite. Gladys est mère de trois enfants tous majeurs et mariés. Gladys est coiffeuse de profession. Gladys a son salon de coiffure à Finagnon un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. En plus de la coiffure, Gladys vend dans son salon de coiffure des produits et articles pour la coiffure. Gladys s’approvisionne en ses différents produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour faire face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle, Gladys sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Gladys was born around 1956 in Sazoué in the Grand-Popo township in the Department of Mono in the south of Bénin. Gladys is married to Assiame Florentin, a civil servant who is presently retired. Gladys is the mother of 3 childrren, all adults and married.

Gladys is a trained hairdreser. She has a hairdressing salon in Finagnon, a district of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Besides hairdressing, Gladys sells products having to do with hairdressing in her salon. She buys the various products in Dantokpa, the big international market of Bénin. In order to meet the ever-increasing demand of her clientele, Gladys is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions, shampoo, hair relaxer, pomades, etc. .

loans.name: Khursheed Maqbool Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a wife of M. A. who has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. People come to him to buy groceries because of his normal rates on groceries which his customers can easily pay. Khursheed baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop. 
 
Khursheed baji is the group leader of three other women from her locality.  Waziran baji and Amina baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell.


This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Khursheed baji is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Guirmen

texts.es: Guirmen tiene 38 años, vive junto a su esposa  y sus 2 hijos, quienes son su inspiración para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años vende comida por las noches en una esquina a 2 cuadras de su casa, prepara platillos rápidos como salchipapas, salchipolllos, anticuchos y choncholines. Para este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la  encargada de atender a los clientes que  acuden a su puesto para probar de estos ricos platillos al paso. Sin embargo, no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, ya que también tiene un motocarro con el que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros durante las mañanas, este oficio lo ejerce desde hace 10 años. Lo que le gusta de ambos negocios es que los mantienen activo, no trabaja presionado y le son muy rentables, ya que los ingresos son diarios y con ellos está solventando los estudios de sus hijos. Con MFP ya tiene 4 préstamos y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que sus compañeros son muy responsables y trabajadores. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la compra de mesas y sillas, porque las que tiene no abastecen a sus clientes que día a día siguen aumentando.  También comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Guirmen is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children, who are his inspiration to get ahead. For the past 5 years he has sold food in the evening on a street corner two blocks from his house. He makes typical local street food such as french fries with sausages, french fries with fried chicken and eggs, and grilled skewers of meat. His wife supports him in this business, waiting on the customers who come to his stall to try the delicious dishes. This is not the only activity he has, though - he also has a motorized three-wheel cart that he uses to transport passengers in the mornings, something that he has done for the past 10 years. What he likes about both businesses is that they keep him active, he is not under a lot of pressure, and the businesses are profitable, producing daily income that allows him to pay for his children's education. He has already had 4 loans with MFP, and what he enjoys about being in a community bank is that his fellow members are very responsible and hard-working. The money that he is requesting now will be used to buy tables and chairs, because the ones he has now are not enough for his growing number of customers. He will also buy parts that he needs to get his vehicle repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs; repair motorized cart

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 25-year-old married woman with three children ranging in age from 8 to 14 years. All her children go to school. She rents and lives in a two-room house with five people. Lydia doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area.

Amina owns a restaurant in a Kampala suburb. She uses public transportation to shop. Amina sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family. She has been in this business for five years.

Amina has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her ninth loan with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and bananas. Amina hopes to see her business grow and she dreams of owning a house on the land that she bought with her business profits.
 

.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and bananas

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alberto G. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero aun y vive desde hace mucho tiempo en el Barrio San Miguel Centro del distrito de Cambyreta.

El señor Carlos posee un Puesto de venta de Cds en la zona baja de la ciudad de Encarnacion desde hace mas de 5 años, y tiene muchos clientes de la zona que siempre compran de su puesto tanto Cds como DVDs y películas. Mediante este trabajo el puede aportar ingresos al hogar, cubrir sus gastos y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le presente.

El hoy día esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas Cds, DVDs y Películas para su puesto. El monto que solicita es de Gs. 1.000.000.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto G. is 28. He is still single, and he has lived in the San Miguel Centro neighborhood in the Cambyreta district for a long time. Carlos has had a place selling CDs in the lower elevation area of the city of Encarnacion for over five years. He has a lot of customers from the area who always buy CDs, DVDs, and movies from him. Through this work he is able to contribute income to his household, cover expenses, and cover anything unexpected that occurs. He is now asking for a loan to buy more CDs, DVDs, and movies for his place. He is asking for Gs. 1.000.000.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs and movies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva casi 9 años vendiendo verduras en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado de la zona),  ella compra su mercancía de dos a tres veces por semana en el sector mayorista del mercado para luego ofrecérselas a sus clientes al por mayor y menor.

Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de su familia, por lo que diariamante ella da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante, su esposo se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi y con las ganancias que ambos perciben tratan de sustentar a su hogar.

Juana necesita de una moto carguera (vehículo motorizado de uso exclusivo para transporte de carga) y así hacer más fácil el transporte de los sacos de verdura que adquiere en el mercado mayorista, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir este ansiado instrumento de trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es poder convertirse en una distribuidora de verduras y valerse de esta moto carguera para distribuir su mercancía en los principales mercados de la ciudad y de esta manera darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, así como una mejor educación para sus hijos.

Juana ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente, demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, motivo por el cual es considerada como una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, lives with her husband and their four children in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling vegetables in the Moshoqueque market (regional market) for nine years. She buys her merchandise two or three times a week in the wholesale sector of the market. She later sells it to her customers for wholesale and retail. This activity is the main source of income for her family. Therefore, she gives all of herself every day to get ahead in her business. Her husband transports cargo and passengers in a motortaxi. With both of their earnings they try to support their household. Juana needs a cargo “moto” (a motorized vehicle used exclusively for transporting cargo) to make it easier to transport the sacks of vegetables that she gets at the wholesale market. That is why we find her asking our institution for a loan for 1,500 PEN, which will allow her to get this longed for instrument for her work. Her biggest desire is to be able to become a vegetable distributor and to make use of this cargo vehicle to distribute her merchandise in the main markets in the city. This way she can give her family a better quality of life and a better education to her children. Juana has previously worked with us and demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments. Therefore, she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cargo vehicle to transport vegetables

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B. is 45 years old and married to Alfredo B., who is a 46-year-old tricycle driver. They have three children, two of whom already have their own families. The youngest, who is eleven, lives with them and goes to elementary school. The B. family lives in the village of Purok Pasil (Zone 1) within Cadiz City, located in Negros Occidental province.

As a tricycle driver, her husband's earnings can sometimes be erratic. Shuttling people around town in a motorcycle with a passenger sidecar cannot always be counted on as a stable source of income; in bad and rainy weather, his income can be virtually nil. Knowing this pushed Aida to make use of her tailoring skills to supplement her husband's income and provide their family with a steadier income.

In 2000 Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and, using an NWTF loan plus her dressmaking and tailoring skills, she began a tailoring business. Because she was a good designer and a skilled seamstress, she soon had many loyal patrons who regularly went to her when they needed clothes. Her tailoring business earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP, enough to pay for her daughter's school expenses as well as defray some of their household expenses.

Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 for working capital for her business was paid on time and in full without delay. Now she is requesting a loan of the same amount for working capital for her tailoring business, and her profits will be used to help supplement the family income.

The above picture shows Mrs. Aida B. with her husband, Alfredo, in her tailoring shop.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To add to her capital for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Jr. Arica, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de frutas y abarrotes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar plátanos, naranjas, piñas, uvas, etc. También arroz, azúcar y fideos, los cuales los comercializa en la feria semanal.

Su mayor deseo es sacar profesionales a sus hijos, surtir mejor su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de plátanos, naranjas, piñas, uvas, etc. También arroz, azúcar y fideos

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason D. is 28 years old and lives in Lila, Bohol.  He has three children.  He sells food to his community for a living.  He needs additional capital in order to make his business become bigger so he can earn more.  He would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance his business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea T. is a villager in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She has four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because this child is only three months old.  Mrs T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field and to make the field more productive. Thus, Mrs. Kunthea T. has decided to ask for a loan for that purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a pig and pig food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Nob No, helps her in the business activities.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field to make it more productive.

loans.name: Ma Joyce

texts.en:
Ma Joyce F. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Ma Joyce is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ma Joyce owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pigs in the local community. Ma Joyce has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma Joyce joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma Joyce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Ma Joyce is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ma Joyce from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for sale

loans.name: Wilfredo Danilo

texts.es: Wilfredo Danilo es un hombre muy trabajador él tiene 1 hijo de 7 años y actualmente está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, el dio inicio a su negocio por cuenta propia pues es su propia fuente de ingresos que es importante para su familia, es así que el ofrece sus productos en algunos lugares en donde tiene clientes que le realizan pedidos por encargos por lo que trata de hacer todo lo posible por complacerlos. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, calzado, ropa para niños y además vestidos y trajes por la temporada festiva. El sueño de él es terminar su casa y proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Danilo is a very hard-working man that has a 7-year-old son under his care. He sells general merchandise. He began his business by his own initiative and it is his own source of income, which is important for his family. He offers his items in areas where customers have placed orders for specific goods and he does his best to fill them. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy pants, footwear, clothing for children and dresses and suits for the festive season. His dream is to finish building his house and provide better living condiditons.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Virginia Marilyn

texts.en:
Virginia Marilyn G. is from the village of Daang Lungsod. She is 55 years-old and married with three adult children. Virginia Marilyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Virginia Marilyn joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Virginia Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarah R. is from Lower Sto. Nino Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Sarah operates a sari-sari store while her husband supports the family as a driver. Her business earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.


Sarah has applied as a full pledge member to PMPC for access to financial support. She has maintained to successfully repay her previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. Her purpose was to expand her store so that she could accommodate more customers. Now, she has a new loan of 10000 PHP, taken from PMPC. The proceeds from this loan will be used to purchase new items to sell. Her additional income serves their daily needs.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MUJERES D. ÉXITO” esta conformado por 11 socias todas vecinas y amigas del mismo lugar.
L. Sra. Yovanna, es L. tesorera del grupo y trata D. desempeñar su labor D. L. mejor manera elL. es enfermera D. profesión antes trabajaba como tal en una clínica en algunas ocasiones hacia guardias particulares para tener otros ingresos, su esposo es marino y por  lo mismo siempre lo enviaban D. un lugar a otro por lo que siempre dejaba sus trabajos, es así que por el bienestar D. su familia deciD. tener un negocio por cuenta propia y empieza en L. venta D. cosméticos elL. tiene muchas amistades a quienes ofrece sus productos actualmente venD. 6 marcas diferentes D. esta forma tiene mas ganancias, también  hace chocotejas y las venD.. Con su trabajo elL. pueD. ayudar en  los estudios a uno D. sus hijos, Mas adelante elL. quiere cambiar  D. rubro y lo que mas ansia es tener un restaurante turístico y preparar platos típicos D. L. región, su préstamo en esta ocasión lo usara para comprar mas productos para venderlos sabe que poco a poco lograra todo lo que se ha propuesto.

* L. Sra. yovanna esta sentada es L. tercera D. L. derecha
texts.en:
The group 'Mujeres D. Éxito' is maD. up of 11 associates, all neighbours and friends from the same place. Yovanna is the treasurer of the group and tries to perform her work to the best of her ability. She is a nurse by profession and used to work as such in a clinic. On some occasions Yovanna performed other particular duties to obtain more earnings. Her husband is a sailor and used to be sent from one place to the other, for which she always had to leave her jobs. For the well-being of her family Yovanna decided to have her own business and began selling cosmetics. She has many friends to whom she offers her products, and sells 6 different brands. In this way she earns more, and she also makes and sells chocotejas (a type of sweet). With her business Yovanna can contribute to her childrens' studies. In the future she wants to change direction and what she is most anxious to have is a tourist restaurant and prepare tipical regional food. Yovanna's loan on this occasion will be used to buy more products to sell. She knows that little by little she will achieve what she has proposed. *Yovanna is seated third from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Faosiath

texts.fr: A. Faosiath est née en 1975 et vit depuis 13 ans à Sikècodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Faosiath est mariée à SALANON Ulrich, un soudeur, et est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Faosiath vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Faosiath n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour supporter les charges familiales, Faosiath vend des sachets et divers articles (savons, conserves, etc.) de façon ambulante. Faosiath s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Faosiath exerce cette activité depuis 11 ans. Faosiath a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Faosiath sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Faosiath A. is born in 1975. She has been living for the last 13 years in the Sikècodji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Faosiath is married to Ulrich Salanon, a welder, and has a child who attends school. Faosiath lives together with her husband and their child. The couple takes care of the family expenses together. Faosiath never attended school. In order to support her family, Faosiath works as a street vendor, selling water packs and various items (soaps, canned food etc). She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been doing it for 11 years. Faosiath had a previous loan from ALIDé, which was duly reimbursed. She is now seeking another loan in order to strengthen her business and to better respond to her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a stock of soap and other items for sale

loans.name: Juana Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana es soltera y tiene dos hijas que se encuentran en colegio, tiene como actividad la venta de comida rapida ( Hanburguesa Salchipapa y otros), en su micro snack, esta actividad es la principal  fuente de ingreso para ellla y su familia donde tambien le ayudan sus dos hijas quienes tambien trabajan para ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, la Sra. Juana es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora siempre esta abierta a otras actividades segun la temporada.

El destino del credito sera para la conclucion de la construccion de su casa donde ellas viviran a demas de aumentar su capital de trabajo. 

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brinadada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is single and has two daughters who are in school. She sells fast food (hamburgers, hotdogs, fries and other combinations), in her mini snack stall, which is the main source of income for her and her family as her two daughters also work to help with household expenses. Mrs. Juana is a responsible and hardworking person always open to other types of work depending on the season. The loan is dedicated towards the completed construction of her home where she lives with her daughters as well as increasing her working capital. She is very grateful to field partner Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in awarding her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of her home

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. is married and has three children. He has no educational background.  Joseph goes fishing and sells his catch to the market women at Elmina, which he has been doing for some time now. His wife is a petty trader.  Joseph uses his income to educate his children and pay utility bills.  Joseph will add the loan to his income to purchase fishing equipment. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to save to buy his own boat.

loans.use: Joseph will add the loan to his income to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is an older woman who lives in the rural area lof Phnom Penh. She was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has four children: one sews clothes in the garment industry and three are already married and live separately. She also has a brother who appears on the left in the picture above. He works in the construction field and provides a small income for the family.

Mrs. N. earns about $2 per day from cultivating a variety of crops on her land in the village. Because she wants to eliminate the expenses incurred in hiring taxis, she is seeking a loan of $1100 to purchase a new motorcycle to commute to work and elsewhere.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Elena San Juan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena S. J., 42 years of age, is married and is a resident of P3 Manabay, Ozamiz City. Elena is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elena S. J.’s Group.

Elena is married to Danilo S. J., a forklift operator with an average net income of P3,600 every 15th and 30th day of the month. They are blessed with six children who are all now in their teens.

To help her husband in supporting their family, Elena decided to engage in a snack-vending business, particularly banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar), and a sari-sari store. For fifteen years already, she has been able to manage this little business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than P1,500 a month which, she said, is so helpful to their family income.

Elena joined Paglaum MPC just this year. As a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting P3,000 as her first loan to add to the capital of her existing business activity which is her sari-sari store and snack-vending business.

The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of Elena’s family, to meet their basic needs, and as savings for future use and for house repair. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive and that all her children will finish their studies up to college level.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store and snack-vending business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario N. is from the village of Lower Lawan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old. Mario is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling scrap metal, empty bottles, and other used products in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more scrap metal to sell and as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence E. is from the town of Surallah. He is 34 years old. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in his business for over four years now. In 2009, Laurence joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Laurence is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm supplies. This loan will be his third from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lesok

texts.en:
Lesok L. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Lesok is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene  48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 28 años se dedica en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, así como algunos artículos para el hogar. Es así que todos los días recorre las calles y realiza visitas a domicilio de sus clientes, en donde ofrece los productos ya sea por catalogo o por muestras que posee, de esa manera se hace más efectiva la venta. Durante todo este tiempo ha visto que la venta de sus productos es rentable, pero tiene sus riesgos al momento de dejar a crédito, por toro lado le es ventajoso por que puede disponer de su tiempo para atender a su familia. Tiene planes mas adelante, como disponer de capital y vender más productos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor y algunos instrumentos sencillos de cocina como set de cucharones, azucareros, siendo estos artículos de mucha demanda por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 48 and lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home. For more than 28 years she has sold cosmetics via catalogue as well as some household articles. Every day she travels the streets, making visits to her clients' homes where she offers products via catalogue or samples, in this way maximising her sales. During all this time she has seen that selling her products is profitable, but has its risks in the moment when she sells on credit, but overall it is advantageous as she can structure her time so that she can attend to her family. Hermelinda has plans in the future, such as to arrange capital and sell more products. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments, and is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks these people who will be the committee for the loan she is seeking and it will be very useful for her business's progress. With the loan she is seeking Hermelinda will invest in the purchase of bulk quantities of cosmetics and some kitchen implements such as ladles, sugar bowls, as these articles are in great demand by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más productos de belleza y artículos de cocina para la venta.

loans.name: Amar

texts.fr: Monsieur  Amar S. est jeune commerçant âgé de 32 a	ns. Il est dans ce domaine depuis 7 ans. Il allait à Bissau en Guinée pour acheter des marchandises pour les revendre à Thiès. En revanche en retournant en Bissau il emportait  des produits qu’il va vendre en Guinée. En d’autre terme il fait de « Import-export informel ». Cependant, il sollicitait un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget d’approvisionnement et préparer son départ en Bissau. Il compte emporter cette fois ci des pièces détachées, poissons fumés et autres…
texts.en:
Mr. Amar S. is a young 32-year-old businessman. He has been in this field for seven years. He goes to Bissau, in Guinea, to buy goods for resale in Thiès. He also brings merchandise with him to Bissau for sale in Guinea. In other words, he practices import-export on an informal level. He is seeking a loan of 100,000FCFA to supplement his stocks and prepare for his next trip to Bissau. He will be taking with him spare parts, smoked fish and other items.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement his stocks

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio D. Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito D. Santiago , provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es Viuda y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con Panadería;  Ella se dedica a administrar su horno panadería; La socia es una mujer fuerte y luchadora y se hace cargo diario D. sus negocio, siendo la cabeza D. familia este negocio sigue siendo el respaldo D. sus hogar  en cuanto a la economía. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar harina, levadura y otros insumos para la panadería. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" ("We go together") community bank and lives in the community of Arcopata, district of Santiago, province of Cusco, Peru. She is a 57-year-old widow with two children. She makes a living working daily at her bakery. She is a strong and hard-working woman who daily tends to her business, and being the head of her family the bakery is the backbone of her household finances. Sofia is requesting the loan to purchase flour, yeast and other ingredients for her bakery. She is grateful to those who help her reach her dream through these means, and she promises to fulfill her payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast and other ingredients

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan P. is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples.

P. sells traditional cakes for an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is employed at the commune hall, earning an income of USD 3 per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase more ingredients to produce cakes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is P.’s second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to produce cakes

loans.name: Sarah Chelagat

texts.en:
Sarah Chelagat C. is a 37-year-old lady married to Joseph Chirchir. They have three children, age 20, 18 and 15 respectively. They live in Kamagut, an outer part of Eldoret town. Sarah has a grocery store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.) per month.

Sarah was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend and she is applying for her fourth loan of Kshs. 30,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan, she plans to buy more bananas and cereals.

She hopes to operate a large-scale grocery shop, where she can be able to supply to hotels and sell the best quality items to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas and cereals

loans.name: Zonia Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Graciela es soltera, vive con sus padres y un sobrino que esta a su responsabilidad, Graciela viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales, quesos, animales menores, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos y de tienda en tienda, en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales.
Graciela solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de trigo, quinua, maíz.
Graciela desea construir una casa en la ciudad de Lima donde desea que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Virgen María communal bank. She is single and lives with her parents and her nephew, for whom she is responsible. Graciela travels to the markets where she buys cereals, cheeses, young animals, and other products that she sells in the wholesale food market and from store to store. Sometimes she processes the cereals.

Graciela is requesting a 1500 PEN loan for the purchase of wheat, quinoa, and corn. She wants to build a house in Lima where she wants her son to study.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, quinoa, and corn.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira C. is the leader of the group. She is 32 and married. Her family has five children. All the children except youngest one are school pupils. Gulmira’s husband supports the family by selling cattle. Four years ago, he was a teacher. He began selling farm animals. Now he has two cows. The loan purpose is to purchase cattle. In the future Gulmira is planning to increase the total number of cattle.

Sharipa N., 36, is married. Her spouse is a private taxi-driver. The couple has four children who are all school pupils. Sharipa runs her own business sewing national wares (national pillows, blankets and so on). She has been doing this for 15 years. After finishing school, she started to take small orders at home. Out of the profits, she bought a car and cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase goats. Sharipa, together with her family, is planning to make major house repairs and obtain an automobile.

Mamaturaim I., 52, is married. His wife earns money by working as a seamstress. The couple has five children. The eldest son works in Bishkek, the daughter is a student, one is working in Russia, and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. The whole family is engaged in cattle breeding. Eight years ago, Mamaturaim made his bread by selling automobile spare parts. With the profit, he has been buying livestock animals. By now, his earnings make it possible to pay for his daughter’s studies. The loan purpose is to purchase two calves. This father aims to put his children on their own feet.

Aitilla K., 50, is married. Her family has four children. Her daughter is married and lives in Bishkek. Her elder son lives in Kara-Balta, another one is a herder and the youngest son is a private builder. The family runs a business breeding cattle. Due to years of working hard, they have managed to increase the cattle stock and purchase a house. The loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals. Aitilla is planning to build a house and to arrange her son’s wedding.

Altynai A., 31, is married. Her family has three children. The oldest children are school pupils. Altynai’s husband's profession is carpentry and he breeds cattle. In six years, they have managed to increase the total number of animals. Now they keep 4 cows and 2 calves. The loan purpose is to purchase cattle. The family intends to build a new house and to increase cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J. is in the business of selling tea and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more inventory.  Susan is 35 years old and married with a husband is is a "boda boda" man -- offering bicycle transportation. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children

loans.use: Stock more inventory to sell

loans.name: Bertilda Armanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Armanda es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y esta muy feliz ya que de la decisión que tomaron hace muchos años han podido recibir ayuda no solo ella si no también sus compañeras del Banco. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación procreo 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven aun con ella, además de dos nietos que los quiere como que si fueran de ella.

Tiene una pequeña panadería donde además de pan fabrica y vende deliciosos pasteles, nos cuenta que es lo que más le gusta hacer ya que se divierte decorando sus obras que son muy apreciadas por las personas que conocen lo que ella hace. Trabaja todos los días desde las  5am hasta la noche que se encarga de dejar todo listo para el nuevo día, vende en su pequeño local.  También vende joyas de fantasía, productos que compra en Portoviejo cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar harina y otros productos necesarios para la fabricación del pan y sus pasteles. Sus sueños son gozar de buena salud y formar una microempresa de fabricación de pasteles.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Armanda is a founding member of her community bank and she is very happy since, because of the decision they took many years ago, herself and her fellow bank members have been able to receive help.  Armanda is 57 years old.  She is married and has 5 grown-up children.  Three of her children still live with her as well as two grandchildren who she loves as if they were her own children.

Armanda has a small bakery where she not only bakes and sells bread but also delicious cakes.  She tells us that this is what she most likes doing because she enjoys decorating her cakes which are very much admired by the people who know what she does.  She works every day from 5.00am until the evening when she makes sure everything is ready for the next day.  She sells her products from her small premises.  Armanda also sells costume jewelry which she buys in Portoviejo every fortnight.

This loan will be used to buy flour and other products which she needs to make her bread and cakes.  Armanda's dreams are to enjoy health and to create a small cake-making business.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, eggs, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Christopher Kyalo

texts.en:
Christopher is 38 years old. He is married to Susan and is the father of three children ages one year, six years, and ten years respectively. He operates a tailoring shop in Wote Trading Center. This has been his primary business for the last seven years. 

He came to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his fourth loan from KADET, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He has not borrowed from other financiers before. 

With this loan, Christopher plans to buy some materials and other swwing items so that he can be able to serve his customers better. He hopes to become a major school uniform distributor in Wote and in Makueni at large.

loans.use: Christopher wants to buy some cloth and other materials

loans.name: Beatriz Cristina

texts.es: Beatriz Cristina H. D. L. D. 38 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia responsable y trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos D. 10 y 14 años D. edad con quienes resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. Beatriz tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga D. confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una D. las mejorar cualidades D. ella. Beatriz elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas D. vestir para vender en su casa D. habitación, donD. también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. Beatriz solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, Beatriz posee la certeza que D. esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en: Beatriz Cristina H. D. Lopez is 38 years old and she is a mother who is responsible and hard working. She lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 10 and 14. The live in the municipality of Soyapango. Beatriz is a seamstress by traD.. She makes formal clothing, uniforms, and casual clothing. She is someone who pays attention to detail and produces high quality work, a fact that has gained her the loyalty of many clients. Her clients are family members, friends, and neighbors. One of her best personal qualities is her sense of responsibility. Beatriz takes orders and she also makes pieces of clothing to sell from her home. She also makes her products at home. Beatriz requests a loan in order to purchase fabrics in various colors and patterns, as well as to purchase threads, needs, and other necessary items to carry out her traD.. Beatriz is certain that she will be able to improve her business, and it will be a benefit to their family.

loans.use: To purchase needles, thread, and fabric.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Leonardo; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados, el juntamente con su esposa trabajan en este negocio de venta de helados que venden en las calles de la ciudad de Urubamba, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una máquina para hacer los helados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Senor Leonardo belongs to the to the "San José de Urubamba" communal bank, which is located in the Urubamba district and province, in the Cuzco region.

Senor Leonardo is 54 years old, and is married with 3 children. He combines his daily activities with running a business selling icecream, together with his wife. They sell their icecream in the streets in the city of Urubamba, and he wants to expand and improve his operation. He his seeking a loan to buy a machine for making the icecream.

He is happy that he can access the loan and promises to complete his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine to make icecreams

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla S. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 55 years old. Priscilla is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Priscilla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Priscilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Priscilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Don Juan José C. T. es empleado de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, ocupando el puesto de Fontanero, desde hace 13 años.

Es casado de 39 años de edad, bachiller, tiene dos personas a su cargo que dependen únicamente de él uno de ellos es menor de edad. El vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el barrio Memorial Sandino.

Se encuentra muy agradecido con CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado este crédito que es el primero y lo utilizará par realizar mejoramiento en su vivienda y darle a su seres queridos una vida más cómoda.
texts.en:
Juan Jose C. Tellez has been working for a water and sewage treatment facility as a plumber for the last 13 years.

He is 39 years old, married, high school graduate, and has two people under his care, one of which is a minor, that depend solely on him.  He lives in the city of Managua in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

He finds himself very grateful to CEPRODEL for giving him his first loan which he will use to make home improvements and give his loved ones a more comfortable quality of life.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy N. (pictured) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has four young children, three sons and one daughter. 

Chanthy is a silk weaver, but she has just delivered a baby so she has stopped the weaving business for a while and has started a new business selling grocery items from her home. Her husband is a driver. 

Chanthy is requesting her second Kiva loan in the amount of $500 in order to provide capital for her mother’s farming business. Chanthy’s mother will use $250 of the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her farm, and another $250 to buy a water-pumping machine.

loans.use: To provide capital for her mother’s farming business.

loans.name: Bello Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, inició los emprendimientos la Sra. Constancia G.,  quien vive en la zona del Km 11 Acaray Asentamiento Bello Horizonte de Ciudad del Este.  Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Bello Horizonte”, está en el Sexto Ciclo con  17 integrantes, quienes desarrollan diversas actividades, en la mayoría, comerciales.  Son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias mutuamente.
La sra. Constancia solicita el crédito para poder abastecer mejor su puesto de ventas con frutas y verduras, frescas y saludables, a fin de ofrecer los mejores productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Constancia G. initiated the formation of this committee, whose members live in the Acary Km 11 in the Bello Horizante ("Beautiful Horizon") neighborhood in Ciudad del Este ("City of the East").  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the area committee.  The committee is called "Beautiful Horizon" and is in its sixth loan cycle.  The 17 members undertake a variety of activites, primarily commercial.  They are very united, responsible and supportive of each other.
 
Constancia is requesting a loan to be better able to stock her sales stand with fresh and healthy fruits and vegetables with the goal of providing the best products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits (citrus) and vegetables.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Age:                            24
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      3
Business:                    selling herbs and spices in the local community
Loan purpose:              to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products 
Weekly profit:              250 WST  ($104)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.9 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:           2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:               1.9 out of 3

Amelia owns and operates a business of selling herbs and spices in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  She plans to use the profits (estimated to be 250 WST or around $104 per week) to expand her business.

In 2011, Amelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Amelia 's 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making her products.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Olga is one of our partners in Hato Mayor and is a member of the group Faith and Hope 1 and 2. Hato Mayor is one the most rural cities in the country, whose economy is dependent on agriculture. Olga is an entrepreneur dedicated to selling jewelry and accessories. She is a young mother of two children who live with her and her long-term partner. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to study. In her free time, she likes to study.

Olga is very excited to receive her 4th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid her previous loans and, with each one, taking steps toward growing her business. For about 2 years, she has been negotiating, starting her her first loan in with us. She is planning to invest the latest loan in the purchase of varieties of jewelry and accessories. She plans to reinvest in her business and improve it in the short term, to have a sustainable future.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and accessories

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old and married.  He runs a tailoring business for a living.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He runs his business in a very competitive environment, hence he puts extra effort to get more customers.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt customer care skills.  He hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: 6 Tân Nam - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Trường Lê Thị (41) is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Trường is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 09.1.6 Nam Ngạn (6 Tân Nam   Nam Ngạn).

Trường is widowed and has 3 adult -aged children. She operates a family member's food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Trường has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2011, Trường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trường is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be her first loan. Trường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  H. Thị Cam (42) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2.  Lê Thị Tuấn (43) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3.  N. Thị Kha (44) is a 21-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trường Lê Thị (41) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Trường là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.1.6 Nam Ngạn (6 Tân Nam  Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Trường thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trường kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Trường đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trường đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. Thị Cam (42) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.
