loans.use: To buy more stock of dippers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun P. is a 60 year old widow who works as a dessert saleswoman; she earns approximately $3.20 per day. She has four children who all live with. Her oldest daughter, Vanthy Ou, is 34 and is a cleaner for a local NGO. Samoeun sells desserts to many citizens in the village. Her business is going well, and she wants to expand the variety of the desserts she sells. Hence, she needs a loan of $400 to use as capital in order to create a larger variety of desserts. The business is a small group that was formed and Samoeun was chosen to be the leader of two other members Mrs. Somang V. and Mrs. Chou K..

Mrs. Somang V., who is 44, is a staff member of a catholic temple, and her husband, who is 45, is a cameraman. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a camera to replace broken camera, which he uses for his picture service. Mrs. Chou K., who is 51, provides a billing service for phone calls. Chuo is requesting a loan $200 to buy more phone cards to stock and sell for profit. They all live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: use as capital to make dessert for sell

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
La señora Palmira tiene 62 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y vive en el Barrio California de Carata en el caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió solamente lo que antiguamente llamábamos transición que equivale al actual primer grado de primaria y no continuó estudiando porque en la escuela de Motil no había más grados. 
Se casó con el señor Amaro Contreras y tuvieron 9 hijos. Actualmente ninguno depende de ellos, pero tienen bajo su protección a un nieto.
Palmira es una mujer emprendedora que se dedicaba a la costura, pero se dio cuenta que en la compra y venta de leña le va mejor ya que es el combustible que utilizan en la zona, entonces actualmente ese es su negocio.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró telas y empezó a almacenar leña.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar leña.
Palmira sueña con incursionar en el negocio de listones de madera.
texts.en:
Señora Palmira is 62 years old and a member of the community bank San Luis. She lives in the neighborhood California de Carata in the region of Motil, district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied only through what was called the transition in the old days, which is equivalent to the present first grade of primary school, and she didn't continue studying because in the school of Motil, there were no other grades. She married to Señor Amaro Contreras and they had nine children. Presently, none depend on them, but they have a grandson under their protection. Palmira is an enterprising woman who was dedicated to sewing, but she realized that purchasing and selling firewood went better for her since since it is the fuel most used in their area, so presently that is her business. With her first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she bought fabric and began to stock up firewood. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in six months, she plans to buy firewood. Palmira dreams of stepping into the business of laths of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy firewood.

loans.name: Maksida

texts.en:
Maksida was born in 1970 and she lives in a Živinice, a village in Bosnia.  She has 3 kids: her oldest son is 20 and works as a construction worker, and her two other sons are 14 and 12 years old and still attend school.  Her husband also works in construction.  

Maksida works at home, raising her children, growing vegetables, and raising cows.  She sells the milk and milk products from her cows in the local market, earning about 150KM/month (the equivalent of roughly $100 USD).  Maksida requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International to purchase food for her cows to survive the winter.

loans.use: To buy food for cows.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky Ruhambika, a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old and her children are between one and 10 years of age. She is running a grocery business. Her business is doing well and it helps her to get money that she uses to take care of her family. Her husband helps her to run this business,. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a deep freezer for her business. In future she plans to expand her business.

She thanks you for your support.

---
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for her business.

loans.name: Taiaopo

texts.en: Taiaopo M., 40, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Taiaopo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for purchasing ingredients to start up a popcorn business.

loans.use: Purchase  wheelbarrow, chain link wires,  fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luisa es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Luisa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. comida, prepara desayunos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, fideo, azúcar, sal.
Los sueños D. Luisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of Banco Comunal Lila. She's 57 years-old, married, and has 6 children. Everyday, Luisa (with the help of her children) operates a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells food and prepares breakfasts. Luisa is requesting a loan of 800 soles ($250 dollars) which she will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, and salt. Luisa longs to improve her business, with the hope that her children will grow up to enjoy professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells palm oil and other food. She is requesting a loan  of $475 (70,000 NGN) to purchase more palm oil and food to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil and food to sell

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana tiene 24 años vive, con su  esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año trabaja día a día en la atención de su bodega, debido a que su local está ubicado cerca a un centro de estudios, la afluencia de público garantizan las ventas diarias, y con ello los ingresos para su familia. Yovana trabaja todos los días para que de esa manera pueda cubrir no solo sus necesidades, sino también el arrendamiento de su local comercial. Su anhelo es tener una gran tienda donde venda diversos productos comestibles. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasmada por seguir adelante con el trabajo en su banco comunal y de ese modo seguir creciendo como persona. El monto que ahora solicita es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor, adquirirá sacos de azúcar, arroz y menestras, además de cajas de golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Yovana is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For a year, she has worked daily in the care of her winery. Her business is located close to a center of study, and the influx of business guarantees daily sales, and thus income for her family. Yovana works every day so that she can cover not only her needs but also the lease of her shop. Her desire is to have a large store where she sells various food products. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP and is excited to continue with work in their community bank, and thus continue to grow as a person. The amount she seeks will be used toward the purchase of groceries at wholesale, purchase bags of sugar, rice, plus boxes of sweets and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Diémé est mariée avec 01 enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Face Néma depuis 2 ans et demi. Awa achète et revend  des produits forestiers et des produits de mer(huile de palme, miel, nététou, des huîtres, de la crevette, du poisson séché et du yet. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce.. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa Diémé is married and raising one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Face Néma for two and a half years. Awa buys woodland and ocean produce (palm oil, honey, "nététou"--a spicy seasoning made from a type of seed; oysters, shrimp, dried fish, and "yet"--dried mollusks) for re-sale. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of woodland and ocean produce

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Ms. Alice C. a single mom with one daughter. She is 58 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her business is a beauty salon which she manages with her own ability and creativity. She studied cosmetology in Manila years ago. She is a member in good standing of Paglaum PMC, Kiva's partner. She seeks a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy supplies for her salon. She hopes that her business will grow better and be able to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic materials to use in her parlor

loans.name: Ndioro

texts.fr: Ndioro D. est âgée de 40 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants. Elles vend de la crème et de la glace en cette période de forte chaleur et aimerait la rentabiliser. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndioro D., age 40, is married and the mother of five. She sells cream and ice during this period of high heat and would like to make her business profitable. She hopes to improve the family’s situation in terms of health and education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cream and ice

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Greetings. Mrs. M. Virginia is a 27 year-old married woman.  She and her husband have 4 children aged as follows: 20, 17, 5 and 3 years old.  They also have 2 orphans of the following ages: 13 and 12 years old. She lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, the Capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur has a plot in Kimisagara market in Nyarugenge district and she sells small fish dried in that market. Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. Previously she used to make $330 as her monthly profit and her husband has income of $330 per month as well. This entrepreneur worked in this sector of business for 5 years and she has 3 workers to help her in that business.

With this loan from Vision Finance Company, Mrs. M. will buy five sacks of small dried fish to expand her business and with the increased profit she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Yraida

texts.es:
La señora Yraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el Jr. Angaiza Nº 240, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre D. 2 hijos que aún dependen D. ella.

Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, comprando un par D. telas y confeccionando algunas ropas, las cuales mostro a sus amigos y vecinos, desD. entonces empezó a hacerse conocida, fue implementándose más y ahorrando para así aumentar sus producciones y poder vender más. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo servicio, por supuesto hoy más renovada y con bastante trabajo ya que realiza diferentes modelos D. costura como calzones, pijamas, carteras y prendas para niños; cuenta con una maquina que es su herramienta principal D. trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, invertirá comprando telas, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad D. variados colores y algunas herramientas D. trabajo como tijeras, para remplazar a las antiguas.
Se siente mejor ahora que en sus inicios, más segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo más constante y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Dice:“Hoy me siento una mujer muy fortalecida y contenta por lo logrado”. Yraida, también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria y ayudar así como a ella a muchas mas mujeres que sueñan salir a adelante solas.
texts.en:
Yraida, who is a member of the Riojana Woman Communal Bank, lives at Jr. Angaiza Nº 240, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother of two children who still depend on her. She tells us that she started out with S/.300,000 of her own, purchasing fabrics and making clothes, which she showed to her friends and neighbors. Since then, she became known, and she has been growing (in her business) and saving up in order to increase her production and be able to sell more. Currently, she continues this business, which of course is now more sophisticated. She has plenty of work since she now creates different types of clothing and accessories such as long underwear, pajamas, purses, and children's apparel. She relies on her sewing machine, which is her main tool for her work. With this loan of S/. 1,200, she will purchase fabrics, threads, elastic, all sorts of notions, and some work tools such as scissors in order to replace the old ones. She is more confident now than when she started out, more sure of the products she offers, and at the same time, more consistent and responsible in making her loan payments. She says: "Now I feel like a very strong woman, content with what I've achieved." Yraida is also grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and a businessperson and for helping her and many others who have dreams to succeed on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and tools

loans.name: Zahida Parveen Abdul Hameed Shahzad Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen baji is a wife of A. H. S. who lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a clothes selling business. He has been in this business for over 3 years. Zahida baji helps him by selling the clothes in the community. She currently needs a loan to advance her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality and those members are as follows:

Shagufta I. baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

I. baji wants a loan to buy items (table covers, chairs and tables) for her catering business.

Rani baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Zahida baji is showing her clothes collection in this picture and holding her granddaughter in her lap.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Aba sells smoked fish at Abura, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to support the family. Aba will use the loan to buy more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to build a store.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is a dedicated woman who helps her husband to generate enough income to cover the basic needs of their young family. Mary Ann is 36 years old and married. She has 3 children. She lives on Candelaria St. in the town of San Enrique, Negros Occidental.

For the past five years, Mary Ann M. has operated a small canteen in the San Enrique School where she sells a variety of low-priced but nutritious food, from which she earns Php 7,000.00 per month. 

Now for her 13th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann wants to borrow PHP 9,500.00 to pay the remaining balance on the motorcycle that she and her husband bought on credit. The motorcycle generates income because her husband uses it as a taxi to drive passengers around the town. Mary Ann also intends to use some of the money as working capital for her canteen.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta T.. She is a jolly “grandmother” to her neighbors in Parola, Tondo, Manila – a shanty village near a busy harbor. Her husband Esteban, age 57, is an auto mechanic. They have 4 children, 2 of whom help them to pay for the family’s daily needs with their own earnings.

Violeta cooks and sells "banana cue," a famous street snack made of caramelized bananas skewered on thin bamboo sticks. This snack is very popular among students and workers. She has been in this business for 5 years and her profits have helped to pay for her family’s daily needs. Violeta earns at least P20, 000.00 a month from her business.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2007. She is due to finish repaying her previous loan with the cooperative. She already applied for a new loan of P10, 000.00 to expand her business. She wants to open additional stalls for selling banana cue in other areas of the city. She dreams of seeing her children finish their college educations.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Centro Napo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Lolita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily used products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: 240003211 Group

texts.es:
Jovana del SocorroS. Mejía de 33 años, Catalina M. de 30 años y Luis M. de 52 años conforman el grupo Rosa Mística. Este grupo tiene cuatro años de trabajar con adim lo que le permitió iniciar con sus negocios.

Jovana S. vende fritanga en su hogar, la fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena. S. es la coordinadora del grupo   y lo que más desea es mejorar el local de su negocio y seguir trabajando por su familia.

Mientras Catalina M. tiene una pequeña pulpería surtida con granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz y dulces, chiverías, jabón, detergente y cloro entre otros. Y Luis M. vende prendas de oro en su casa y por encargo.
texts.en:
Jovana is 33 years old, Catalina is 30 years old, and Luis is 52 years old. They make up the Mystic Rose Group. This group has been working with ADIM for 4 years, and that has permitted them to initiate their businesses.

Jovana sells “fritanga” from her home – a "fritanga" is the popular restaurant par excellence in Nicaragua. This consists of selling foods that are simply cooked over a grate. Generally, these are bought for supper. Jovana is the group's coordinator and what she desires most is to improve her place of business and to keep on working for her family.

Meanwhile, Catalina has a small grocery store that carries basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn, sweets, snacks, soap, detergent and bleach, among other things. And Luis sells gold gifts from his house and by special order.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEAT, PLANTAINS, CABBAGE, TOMATOES, CARROTS FOR COOKING

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Locumba” del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo, vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara, ella pudo estudiar secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa importada, para venderlo en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es poder educar a su hijo.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa importada.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Marivic and her husband, Crispin, in the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. Aside from this, her husband also manages their farm while Marivic sells cosmetics in their village to earn additional income.

For the continuous development of their transport business, Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. This will be used for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle that they use for their transport business so as to ensure the safety of their customers. Marivic hopes that her loan request will be granted for it will also assist her in her retailing business.

The couple are blessed with three children. The eldest is already a college graduate while the youngest is still studying. The couple hopes that their youngest child will also receive a college degree.

loans.use: To repair and maintain their motorcycle

loans.name: Eda

texts.en: Eda B. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 42 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Eda owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Eda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Eda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 38 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à des liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le  commerce d’articles divers et collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, elles  comptent acheter,   une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et d’arachide. L’arachide sera transformée en pâte. L’arachide est acheté sur place et dans les villages environnants, les condiments alimentaires sont achetés en gros à Bamako et le tout  est revendus sur place au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 22 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour la nourriture, la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi are married women who average 38 years of age and 2 children each.  With their husband and children, they live in large traditional families residing in the village of Konobougou, Sub-prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou, Republic of Mali.  The group members know one another through ties of community and commerce.  They do commerce in a variety of goods and are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in want of continual financial support for their businesses.  They are on their second group loan.  The preceding one was properly repaid.  As for the use of the new loan, they intend to buy a large quantity of condiments and peanuts.  The peanuts, to be processed into peanut butter, are purchased locally and in surrounding villages.  The condiments are purchased wholesale in Bamako.  Everything is sold locally to customers composed of women and men at the market and along the asphalt.   The members of the group each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used for food, health care, and the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and peanuts

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive solo y su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 meses empezó a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, pues es  propietario de un motocarro, con el que trabaja por horas, ya que también estudia una carrera universitaria (contabilidad), vende tarjetas telefónicas y recargas virtuales. 
A Robert le gusta mucho su trabajo porque así conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona con muchas personas, no tiene inconvenientes y le va muy bien.
Él se esfuerza cada día porque sus ganancias solventan sus estudios universitarios y él quiere terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y está contento porque tiene una buena relación con sus compañeros y todos son responsables y organizados. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro y comprará más tarjetas telefónicas para la venta.
texts.en:
Robert is 22 years old. He is single and lives alone in his own home. Six months ago he began to offer a passenger transportation service. He is the owner of an auto rickshaw that he works with part time. He is also studying at the university (accounting) and he sells pre-paid telephone cards and virtual recharges. Robert likes his job a lot because he gets to see a lot of places and relate to a lot of people. He has no problems and it is going very well for him. He makes an effort every day because his earnings pay for his university studies and he wants to finish his major and practice his profession. This is his first loan with MFP. He is a member of a communal bank and he is happy because he has a good relationship with his fellow members and all of them are reasonable and organized. With the money he is requesting he will have his auto rickshaw repaired and purchase more pre-paid telephone cards to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his auto rickshaw

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto N. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Crisanto is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanto raises pigs to sell in the future. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $115 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Crisanto joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Crisanto is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 5th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en: Mrs. Mealea M. is 37 years old. She lives in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Vuty Say, are farmers who own 1 hectara of land to cultivate rice and crops. In the field, the family has some problems because their crops have been damaged by insects.  Moreover, the field has infertile soil, but the family does not have sufficient money to buy supplies to change this. Thus, Mrs. Mealea M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She is the mother of three children who are studying in a local public school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is a 42 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Oussama has been selling scrap metal for two years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop. Oussama has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.
Oussama offers a wide range of products. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends and neighbors. When he started his business he had some financial issues purchasing the required stock. Oussama decided to run his business because he took over his family’s business. In the future, he plans to keep improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
El señor Alejo es socio del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 meses, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 02 hijos. El estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a brindar servicio de mototaxi.

Alejo nos cuenta que  el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

El solicitará un crédito  de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar algunos repuestos para su moto, ya que necesita mantenimiento.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse un taxi para trabajar mejor y así obtener mejores ingresos. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la amistad que existe con las compañeras
texts.en:
Alejo has been a member of the Las Calceteras Communal Bank for five months. He lives in the Juliaca district, San Román province, Puno department. He is a 41 year old widower, and he has two children. He has a high school education, and he provides “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) services. Alejo tells us that the first loan he requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement was for 600 PEN, and he used it to increase his capital. He will ask for a loan for 600 PEN. With the loan he will be able to buy some replacement parts for his motorcycle because it needs maintenance. His dream for the future is to buy a taxi to work better and get better earnings. What he likes best about his Communal Bank are the savings and the friendship that exists with his colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento PICAFLOR  representadas por su mesa directiva:

La sra. Maria es la Presidenta del Banco  tiene como actividad la venta víveres a pedido en la zona D. Villa Fátima en su domicicilio, esta casada y tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del credito comprara viveres para poder cumplir con sus clientes; 

la Sra. Wendy  es la secretaria D. actas ella se dedica  a la promoción D. cosméticos D. diferentes marcas reconocidas en el medio, el dinero lo utilizara para la compra D. productos D. belleza que se encuentran en promocion para despues poder venderlos al precio original.

El sr. Miguel es el tesorero su actividad es la venta por mayor D. ropa nueva que lo trae directamente D. Iquique y lo reparte por los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad D. La Paz, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor. 

Como representantes del Banco D. emprendimiento Picaflor compuesta por 8 personas se garantizan mutuamente, porque se conocen  y ponen su garantia para este segundo crédito con nuestra institución pues el 100% tienen negocios estables y rentables.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Picaflor Communal Bank is represented by its governing board: Maria is the president of the bank. She sells supplies by order in the Villa Fátima area. She sells at home. She is married and has school-age children. She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies to be able to satisfy her customers. Wendy is the secretary, and she promotes different well known brands of cosmetics. She will use the money to buy beauty products that she finds on promotional sales and later sell them at the original price. Miguel is the treasurer. He sells new clothes wholesale. He brings them from Iquique and distributes them to the different markets in the city of La Paz. He will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. As representatives of the Picaflor Communal Bank, which is comprised of eight people, they mutually guarantee this second loan. They do this because they know each other and 100% of them have stable and profitable businesses. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Zarafo

texts.en:
T. Zarafo, 30, runs a beauty salon offering hair styling, haircutting, manicure, and cosmetology. She also rents out wedding dresses and accessories for decorating wedding cars. The salon is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Zarafo is planning to remodel her salon and requests $1125 US Dollars. Zarafo thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Remodeling beauty salon

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar N. is a 30-year-old man.  He lives in the town of Ulaanbaatar.  He is married and has 2 very young children.  To make a living, Naranbaatar owns and operates a taxi.  Naranbaatar has been engaged in this business for over 4 years, and earns approximately 400,000 tugrug a month from it.

In 2010, Naranbaatar joined Credit Mongol to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He is now requesting a new loan of 500,000 tugrug.  The current loan will be used to finish building his house.

About Credit Mongol:
Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro and SME clients and to become the best performing company in micro and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. smokes fish as well as frying fish for sale at Abura.  Ekua has not received any form of education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ekua has been selling both fried fish and smoked fish for some time now. She helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to fry and to smoke for sale. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to fry and to smoke for sale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn S. is from the village of Landing. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dry goods in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a videoke unit. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a videoke unit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: necessary things for her husband's shop

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila C. is from the village of San Jose. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Leonila owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her twelfth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cotamoru Group

texts.fr:
M. Kizito, jeune gens de 23 ans, célibataire, il n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il vit avec sa mère et trois frères et une sœur. C’est lui qui est responsable de la famille.
Membre du groupe appelé COTAMORU (Coopérative de taxi motards de Rubavu),  qui est un groupe de transporteurs de taxi moto, c’est un groupe d’une cinquantaine des membres subdivisé en petits groupes de dix personnes. Beaucoup d’entre eux utilisent les motos qui ne sont pas les leurs. Kizito, lui a besoin un prêt pour augmenter ses épargnes pour acheter sa propre moto. Comme tout autre groupe, il donne une garantie de caution solidaire.
Kizito et son groupe travail pour augmenter la capacité financière de leur groupe, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business.les bénéfices récoltés de leur business sont réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer leur meilleur future.

Concernant le groupe
Un prêt de groupe signifie que chaque membre prend son montant et l’utiliser pour son propre business, l’avantage est que le groupe garantisse pour les prêts individuels de chaque membre et si un membre devient garant de ses engagements, tout les membres du groupe remboursent à sa place.
texts.en:
M. Kizito, aged 23, is an unmarried young man who did not attend school.  He lives with his mother, three brothers, and a sister.  Kizito is the head of the family.  He is a member of the group called COTAMORU (Coopérative de taxi motards de Rubavu), a co-op of motobike taxi drivers of Rubavu which is a group of about fifty members subdivided into small groups of ten persons.  Many of them use motorbikes that are not theirs.  Kizito himself has need of a loan to increase his savings in order to purchase his own motorbike.  As with any other group, he is jointly guaranteed.    Kizito and his group work to increase the financial capacity of their group and to upgrade their businesses.  In fact, the group has signed a loan with Amasezerano Community Banking to buy goods to supply their businesses.  The profits gathered from their business are reinvested to maintain the group's financial stability and to save money in order to have a better future.  Concerning the group. A group loan means that each member takes his amount and uses it for his own business.  The advantage is that the group guarantees the individual loans.  And if a member becomes answerable for his commitments, all the members of the group pay up for him.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motorbike for transport

loans.name: Delvy Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Delvy Marina E. G. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos que dependen de
ella. Delvy tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en su casa de habitacion ubicada en Jicaro
Galan de San Lorenzo, Valle. Delvy es una persona muy trabajadora que con muchos esfuerzos ha sacado adelante a su familia. La hija de Delvy tambien le ayuda a vender ropa despues de sus clases en el colegio. Como microempresaria, Delvy desea lograr su sueño en un futuro no muy lejano de que su negocio crezca para poder brindarle mas oportunidades a sus hijos y dejarles un patrimonio para su futuro.
texts.en:
Delvy Marina E. G. is 45 years old. She is a single mother with two children who are dependent on her. Delvy has a business selling new and used clothing in her home, which is located in Jicaro Galan, San Lorenzo, Valle. Delvy is a very hard-working person who has been able to help her family get ahead through great effort. Delvy's daughter also helps her sell clothing after her classes at school. As a microentrepreneur, Delvy would like to achieve her dream in the near future of expanding her business so she can provide more opportunities to her children and leave them an inheritance for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three bales of sorted clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan K. is currently in the business of selling textbooks, exercise books, boxes of chalks, pens, etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more textbooks and exercise books to sell. Juan is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a clinical officer. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a pharmacy.

loans.use: Stock more textbooks and exercise books to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia M. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 48 years old. Leticia is married and has five school-aged children. Leticia owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Leticia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Eunice Akinyi

texts.en:
Eunice Akinyi A. is a business-oriented lady who sells new clothes and hand bags both from her shop and as a hawker. She is 40 years old and married, with five children aged 24, 22, 19, 17, and 11. Akinyi has been in this business for the past seven years. 

She has been able to improve the living standards of her family from the income she gets from her business where she takes home a profit of about 15,000 thousand Kenyan shillings per month. She also gets additional income from her husband. She lives and operates her business from Eldoret town. 

Eunice is now applying for her third loan term with KADET which she will use to purchase more handbags for sale. She hopes to use the profits to stabilize her business and support those under here care.

loans.use: purchasing store inventory

loans.name: Nancy Wamweru

texts.en:
Nancy Wamweru is a hardworking lady who runs a greengrocery stall in Huruma, Nairobi. She is a 44-year-old single mother who takes care of her four children: aged 24 years in college; Michael, 20 years old, and Peter, 18 years old, in secondary school.

Nancy has operated her business for ten years and earns an income of Kshs 12,000 per month; most of her clients are her neighbors in Huruma and passersby.

Nancy was introduced to KADET by a client who is already a member and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs 20,000. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to her greengrocery and to add to her business by selling french fries (locally known as chips) and fruit salads as a secondary business.
	
Nancy desires to see herself own a hotel (restaurant) and be able to supply fruits and vegetables to the hotel owners in the near future. She wishes to offer her children the best education.

loans.use: To add more stock to her greengrocery and to diversify into selling french fries and fruit salads

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, de 21 años, es un joven muy bueno y ambicioso, él vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos menores en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Metrado. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en el trasporte público; como Metrado es muy lejos y no hay acceso de vehículos, por ello tiene mucha demanda el servio que presta y ante eso le genera buenos ingresos. Pero la actividad donde más se divierte es la agricultura, Denis tiene su propio terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos el cual los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki en temporadas donde hay mayor demanda; gusta mucho de cortar las ramas y cosechar los plátanos. Por otro lado desea sembrar café pero para ello deberá juntar capital para comprar más terrenos de cultivos. Es el  tercer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado por su banco comunal, donde existe unión y coordinación entre sus miembros. Con el crédito que solicitas, comprará abono y remedios para sus cafetales de esa manera evitará que la plaga de insecto perjudiquen sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Denis, age 21, is a well-mannered and ambitious young man who lives with his parents and two younger siblings in his own house in the town of Metrado. Every morning he begins work in the early morning hours at his job in public transportation. Since Metrado is located far way, there is not access to vehicles. As a result there is great demand for the service Denis provides, which helps him generate a good income. In addition to this job, Denis also spends a great deal of time farming. He has his own land on which he grows coffee and bananas to sell in the city of Pichanaki during times of peak demand. Denis enjoys pruning branches and harvesting the bananas. On the other hand, he wants to grow coffee so that he can raise enough capital to buy more farmland.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support of his Communal Bank. Unity and coordination are exhibited among its members. With the loan he requested, Denis will buy compost and remedies for his coffee plants in order to avoid plagues of insects that can negatively impact their growth.

loans.use: Purchase compost & remedies for his coffee plants

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Mrs. Thelma D. is from the barangay of P3 Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and blessed with 1 child who is still a minor. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a public utility van operation and a fish pond business. She is also a receiving monthly allotment from her husband's work as an overseas seaman. She’s been a PUV operator for 3 years already and is a new operator for the fish pond business. She is earning an average amount of PHP 13,000 a month from her PUV operation. 

Just this year, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As a member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Thelma is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as her 1st loan. This loan will be used for the financing of her pond culture and production, especially to purchase feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family by meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, paying for her child’s education and for possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Financing of her pond culture and production

loans.name: Marcos Guillermo

texts.es:
Marcos de 31 años, es chofer de un bus, vive con su esposa e hijos en PrimaV. de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

El alquilaba un taxi para recorrer las calles de Guayaquil y tener dinero para mantener a su familia, poco a poco fueron creciendo los gastos de su familia así que decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en una bus. En la actualidad tiene su bus inscrito en una cooperativa de transporte trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta que acaba su turno. 

Para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena y bloques para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere hacer la loza de su casa.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 31, works as a bus driver and lives with his wife and children in PrimaV. de Duran, a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Marcos rented a taxi for driving through the streets of Guayaquil so that he could earn money to support his family. As his family expenses grew over time, he decided to invest all of his savings in a bus. At the moment, his bus is registered with a transportation cooperative. He works every day from the early morning hours until his shift ends.

Marcos wants to provide his children a good life, so he will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and blocks for building a better house. In the future, he wants to have the foundation of his house completed.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, and blocks for his house

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Martha tiene 53 años de edad y está casada hace 30  y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 29 y 22 años,  el menor aun vive con ellos y estudia en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos  y estos los entrega en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también  hace nuevas ventas. Compra sus productos en Portoviejo, trabaja sola  todos los días y realiza los cobros los días sábados, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque es muy paciente con ellos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para incrementar su negocio. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por sus facilidades de pago. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
In the City of Charapoto, the Communal Bank La Rosa de Guadalupe gathers every 15 days.  This district is known for its traditional culture and for being located within minutes of two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  

Señora Martha is 53 years old and has been married for over 30 years.  From her marriage, she has two children, one of 29 years old and another of 22 years old.  The youngest still lives with her and her husband and studies at the university.  Her husband is a shop owner.  

She works in sales, selling all types of clothing.  She has a lot of clients that make orders, which she then delivers to their house.  She allows her products to be sold by credit and makes weekly collections, which is an advantage since she receives payments while making new sales.  She purchases her products in Portoviejo, works alone every day, and collects her payments on Saturdays.  She says that she has a lot of clients because she is very patient with them.  

This credit will be used to purchase merchandise to increase her business.  It's her fourth cycle in the Communal Bank and she is appreciative of the easy payments.  Her dream is to have her own local shop.

loans.use: Purchase clothes.

loans.name: Sonida

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonida S. is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Veng Khy, is 23 years old.  They have been married since 2009 and have a young son. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 km. from Phnom Penh City. 

Sonida and her husband are weavers. In addition, her husband is also a fisherman. Sonida had asked for a Kiva loan once before, she is now asking for another loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials to continue her weaving business, and to buy a boat for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials, and buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make his shop larger

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la reparación de cocinas a gas de segunda mano para luego venderlas, su esposo, es quien realiza esta actividad, mientras que ella es la encargada de venderlos en las ferias comerciales de su zona. Los años de experiencia de su esposo  son la garantía de un buen trabajo realizado que minimiza los riesgos, eso le permite mejorar en sus ventas, adicionalmente a esto vende tejidos a mano que ella misma elabora en sus tiempos libres. Ha visto que la venta de cocinas es muy rentable por lo que desea para más adelante  mejorar en sus ventas. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, que son responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de más cocinas para reparar y vender.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and lives at her parents’ home, along with her husband and two children.  She repairs and resells second hand gas kitchen stoves and has been doing so for three years.  Her husband makes the repairs and she makes the sales at various commercial fairs within her zone.

Her husband’s hears of experience are their guarantee of good quality work and low risk.  This allows them to improve their sales.  Apart from this she also sells hand knitted items that she makes in her spare time.  She has seen that the sale of stoves is very profitable and wants to increase her sales in the future.

This will be her eighth loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are people she knows and they are all united and responsible.

She is grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible because it will be very helpful to her.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more used stoves to repair and sell.

loans.use: Stoves for repair and resale

loans.name: Jun Rey

texts.en:
Jun Rey is from the village of Owaon, Dapitan City. He is 20 years old, single and no children. Jun Rey operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising different vegetables and crops. He has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jun Rey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jun Rey is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jun Rey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn T. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 27 years old, and she is the leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults on their loan.

Jonalyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 12000 PHP, to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Jonalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Stefano

texts.en:
Stefano, 53, is a married father of four children who are between the ages of 14 and 25. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and sells his bananas, coffee, maize and beans to the local market. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family.

Having recently repaid his previous 40,000 Kes loan from Juhudi Kilimo, he has requested a new loan of 40,000 Kes to upgrade his banana farming. The extra income arising from this loan will help improve the living standards of his family. Stefano aspires to acquire a pick-up truck in the future to help in transporting bananas to the market.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana farming.

loans.name: Saby

texts.es: Saby tiene 27 años, vive sola en una casa alquilada. Desde hace un año y medio empezó a trabajar de manera independiente en sus múltiples negocios, entre ellos vende frazadas, artículos para el hogar como ollas, asimismo se dedica a la organización de eventos sociales. Su método de venta es por medio de catálogos, así los clientes puede pedir con tiempo el producto o artículo que desea, y mas adelante cancelar la compra. Ella disfruta mucho realizar ambas actividades, ya que así puede ser independiente, sin embargo manifiesta que la única dificultad que tiene es cuando sus clientes no pagan a tiempo su cuotas, para lo cual ha sabido superarlas con estrategias de cobranzas, es por eso que su gran sueño es  tener más capital  para  que su negocio tengan mayor rentabilidad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería, entre frazadas, sábanas y otros artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Saby is 27 years old and lives in a rented house. A year and a half ago, she started working independently in multiple businesses. These include selling blankets, household goods such as pots, as well as organizing social events. Saby sells her products through catalogs, which gives her customers time to choose the products and goods they want that they can pay for later. She enjoys both businesses and being able to work independently. However, Saby says her greatest difficulty is when her customers do not pay their bills on time. She has overcome this problem by enacting collection strategies. Her greatest wish is to have more capital so that her business will be more profitable.

This is her second loan with MFP. Saby is extremely happy to know that she has financial support, so she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her group because all the members are responsible and support people. She thanks those responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her businesses. The loan she requested will be used to by merchandise such as blankets, sheets, and other household goods.

loans.use: Purchase blankets, sheets, and other household goods

loans.name: Peter  Onyango

texts.en:
Peter is twenty eight years old and single. He runs a photo studio as a primary business and at the same time does laundry services in Gomongo Thika.

Peter is servicing his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan amount to purchase a new camera.

Peter will use the anticipated profit to boost his business and also improve his living standards.He hopes to settle down and have a family,and  expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Modesta is a talented and dynamic woman. She lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her husband. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.  Modesta wants to expand her business (a Comedor, home restaurant, where normally clients are from the same community, especially for lunch), into a small restaurant where she can sell breakfast, lunch and dinner. She is excited to receive her 10th loan, and wants to continue improving her business in the future. 

With this loan, she will be able to buy goods to prepare meals, like rice, meat, beans, tables, chairs, etc. She intends to use her business profits to invest in her business, buying more chairs, tables, tablecloths and other items.  

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. 

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, beans, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 4 hijos.
Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica la venta de menú (alimentos), su negocio queda en una avenida principal y tiene mucha acogida por los comensales que a diario la visitan.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 2 galones de aceite, 6 manteles de plástico, 1 docena de jarras, 1 balde grande, 1 olla grande.
Tiene que implementar bien su cocina para que pueda seguir trabajando cómodamente, gracias a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de brindarle sus créditos cada ciclo para mejorar cada día.
manteles
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Las Rosas communal bank in the Yarinacocha district, within the Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, is married, and they have four children.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for four years and she sells food on a main street.  Her sales are good because of the diners who visit her daily.

She will use the money from this loan of 1,500 PEN to buy a sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, 2 gallons of cooking oil, 6 plastic table cloths, a dozen pitchers, a large pail, and a large pot.

She needs to equip her kitchen well in order to be able to keep working comfortably.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity through the loans each cycle, she can improve daily.

loans.use: to resupply her restaurant

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng T. is 27 years old and sells items such as cooking ingredients, sweets, and soft drinks in front of her house. Chheng’s retail customers are passers-by as well as nearby neighbors. She has been running her shop for a long time and earns around 4 USD a day. Her husband works in the construction sector and also is a fisherman to earn extra income. The couple has a lovely young child who is attending school. 

Chheng is requesting a loan to buy extra grocery items to sell at her shop. She will also save part of her loan so that her husband may buy fishing tools.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and fishing equipment

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla L. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosevilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This loan will be Rosevilla's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches   covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima is 35 years old, single, and has one child.  They live in West Point. Maima has been operating a boutique where she sells clothes for the past four years. She faces a lot of problems during the rainy season. Maima is requesting a loan to purchase blouses, jeans, shirts, and skirts for her business. She plans to build a house for her child and send the child to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, jeans, shirts, and skirts

loans.name: Nd 1-1 Group

texts.en:
Thom is 57 years old with 3 children. One of them is studying at Financial and accounting University.  She has been a client of our credit program since 2004 and has accessed seven loan cycles — the last one for 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong. All loans were used to invested in expanding her  vegetable shop. Being the leader of a four-member group, she is responsible for punctual repayment. For her new loan size cycle, she is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong to improve her shop conditions and buy products to meet the demand of customers.

Thoa is 55 years old with three children. She has a butcher shop in a local market. She needs a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong to invest in her shop
 
Van is 53 years old with two children. She manages a shop that sells fresh vegetables. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to improve her shop.

Huong is 42 years old with two children. She grows rice and vegetables, and raises chickens. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese dong to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to improve her shop conditions and buy products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 2 children. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Susan is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also raises chickens to sell their eggs. Susan plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and chicken feed. Susan hopes to have a progressive business. She also wishes for her children to finish college and to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chicken feed

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es: Marlenis vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 16 años, en el barrio Crespo de la ciudad de Cartagena, en un sitio muy cercano al mar y al aeropuerto de esta ciudad. Allí se dedica a la venta de ropa  que promociona mediante una guía especializada de productos. Desde hace 4 años cuando Marlenis se dedicó a transportar  niños, vio en el mercado de las madres de estos pequeños, la oportunidad de venderle mercancías  y empezó entusiasmada por una amiga, quien ya se dedicaba a este negocio a través de un catálogo.  De esta manera consiguió su primer mercado y gradualmente su buen servicio y la oportunidad de su oferta hicieron que su clientela creciera. En la actualidad el segmento de mercado que aborda Marlenis,  está ubicado en sectores muy exclusivos de la ciudad de Cartagena,  donde ha encontrado clientes rentables que la recomiendan entre sus conocidos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en un gran volumen mercancías que vinieron con muy buenos descuentos. Su meta es lograr todos los días impactar un nuevo cliente,  pues quiere cumplir el sueño de generar mayores ingresos que le permitan ahorrar y ofrecer un  mayor bienestar a su familia, para que sus hijos en un futuro tengan las bases para convertirse en personas exitosas.
texts.en: Marlenis lives with her husband and two children, who are 14 and 16. They live in the Crespo neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, in a place that is very close to the ocean and the airport of that city. There she sells clothes that she offers through a specialized product guide. Four years ago, when   Marlenis started providing transportation for children, she saw the market with the mothers of these little ones- the opportunity to sell them merchandise. She started with encouragement from a friend, who was already in the business via a catalogue. In this way, she got her first customers and gradually, with good service and what she was offering, her clientele grew. At present, the market segment that is by Marlenis is located in exclusive areas of the city of Cartagena, where she has found profitable customers who recommend her to their acquaintances. Her Kiva loan is the first loan she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy a large volume of merchandise that coms with good discounts. Her goal is to have an effect on her customers every day. She wants to make her dream come true of making more income that will allow her to save and offer more wellbeing to her family, so that her children in the future will become successful people.
